- Hey, everyone, and I hope
you're having an amazing day.
It's Mark Wiens, I'm in Bangkok, Thailand,

and just sitting down for a
really simple, quick lunch.
Look's like a donut fried egg.
Oh, the yolk, take a bite, get chilies,
there's basil on here.
Oh, wow.
Yeah, that's delicious.
But ever since I took a trip to Pakistan,

which was really, it was
the trip of a lifetime,

I have been wanting to
go back to Pakistan.
(bottle hisses)
Welcome to Karachi!
I'm very excited to be back,
and I wanna say huge thank you to Pepsi
for sponsoring this video.
Today, actually in this video,
we are going to go on

an ultimate Western Pakistani
continental street food tour!
We're starting in Karachi,
we're gonna go to Islamabad,
we're gonna go to Lahore,
we're gonna eat burgers,
the chutneys are gonna flow,
it's gonna be some amazing food

that I'm gonna share everything
with you in this video,

and again, a huge thank you to
Pepsi for making this happen!
(excited music)

We just arrived to a place
called Nursery Burger.

Oh, you could smell the
burger fumes in the air!
(music jams)

Their burger production at
Nursery Burger is so impressive!

Just watching so many
of the Pakistani dishes
three different types that you can order.
You can order the beef chapli,
which is like a hamburger,
you can order the chicken chapli,
which is like a chicken burger,
and then you can order the vegetable,
which is, looks like a potato patty.
Those all go onto the hot plate,
then on the other side of the hot plate,
he takes a swipe of chutney,
puts that onto the bun,

then he loads it up with
a mixture of onions,

and it looks like there's
some coriander in there
and maybe some slices of beetroot!
(restaurant chatter)
(groovy music)
He cuts it in half.
Immediately, that goes onto,

like scooted off the
hot plate onto a plate
and then they squeeze on both a chutney

and then tomato sauce onto the
plate that you could dip in.

feels like a dream, but always reality.
- Reunited!
Joel is here.

- Oh, so beyond excited, beyond
words, literally right now.

- We're so, yeah, it's so

Again, the warm welcome,
we're starting with super,
not just Nursery Burger,
this is the Super Nursery Burger.

pretty much the story is that
the brothers went to America.
They worked for a fast food franchise,

and they wanted to bring
it to Pakistan, to Karachi,
but then they got turned down.
- Exactly.
- They got turned down,
so eventually they had an idea, they said,

we're gonna make our own
burger franchise in Pakistan,
and that was back in 1980.
Then, they opened up their own franchise,
they opened up their own Mr. Burger,

So, it has a unique story in Pakistan,
